01455   // This forward declaration is needed since extendComplexSelector calls extendCompoundSelector, which may recursively
01456   // call extendComplexSelector again.
01457   static Node extendComplexSelector(
01458     Complex_Selector* pComplexSelector,
01459     Context& ctx,
01460     ExtensionSubsetMap& subsetMap,
01461     set<Compound_Selector> seen);
01462 
01463 
01464 
01465   /*
01466    This is the equivalent of ruby's SimpleSequence.do_extend.
01467 
01468     // TODO: I think I have some modified ruby code to put here. Check.
01469   */
01470   /*
01471    ISSUES:
01472    - Previous TODO: Do we need to group the results by extender?
01473    - What does subject do in?: next unless unified = seq.members.last.unify(self_without_sel, subject?)
01474    - IMPROVEMENT: The search for uniqueness at the end is not ideal since it's has to loop over everything...
01475    - IMPROVEMENT: Check if the final search for uniqueness is doing anything that extendComplexSelector isn't already doing...
01476    */
01477   template<typename KeyType>
01478   class GroupByToAFunctor {
01479   public:
01480     KeyType operator()(ExtensionPair& extPair) const {
01481       Complex_Selector* pSelector = extPair.first;
01482       return *pSelector;
01483     }
01484   };
01485   static Node extendCompoundSelector(
01486     Compound_Selector* pSelector,
01487     Context& ctx,
01488     ExtensionSubsetMap& subsetMap,
01489     set<Compound_Selector> seen) {
01490 
01491     DEBUG_EXEC(EXTEND_COMPOUND, printCompoundSelector(pSelector, "EXTEND COMPOUND: "))
01492 
01493     Node extendedSelectors = Node::createCollection();
01494 
01495     To_String to_string;
01496 
01497     SubsetMapEntries entries = subsetMap.get_v(pSelector->to_str_vec());
01498 
01499 
01500     typedef vector<pair<Complex_Selector, vector<ExtensionPair> > > GroupedByToAResult;
01501 
01502     GroupByToAFunctor<Complex_Selector> extPairKeyFunctor;
01503     GroupedByToAResult arr;
01504     group_by_to_a(entries, extPairKeyFunctor, arr);
01505 
01506 
01507     typedef pair<Compound_Selector*, Complex_Selector*> SelsNewSeqPair;
01508     typedef vector<SelsNewSeqPair> SelsNewSeqPairCollection;
01509 
01510 
01511     SelsNewSeqPairCollection holder;
01512 
01513 
01514     for (GroupedByToAResult::iterator groupedIter = arr.begin(), groupedIterEnd = arr.end(); groupedIter != groupedIterEnd; groupedIter++) {
01515       pair<Complex_Selector, vector<ExtensionPair> >& groupedPair = *groupedIter;
01516 
01517       Complex_Selector& seq = groupedPair.first;
01518       vector<ExtensionPair>& group = groupedPair.second;
01519 
01520 //      DEBUG_EXEC(EXTEND_COMPOUND, printComplexSelector(&seq, "SEQ: "))
01521 
01522 
01523       Compound_Selector* pSels = new (ctx.mem) Compound_Selector(pSelector->pstate());
01524       for (vector<ExtensionPair>::iterator groupIter = group.begin(), groupIterEnd = group.end(); groupIter != groupIterEnd; groupIter++) {
01525         ExtensionPair& pair = *groupIter;
01526         Compound_Selector* pCompound = pair.second;
01527         for (size_t index = 0; index < pCompound->length(); index++) {
01528           Simple_Selector* pSimpleSelector = (*pCompound)[index];
01529           (*pSels) << pSimpleSelector;
01530         }
01531       }
01532 
01533 
01534 
01535 //      DEBUG_EXEC(EXTEND_COMPOUND, printCompoundSelector(pSels, "SELS: "))
01536 
01537 
01538       Complex_Selector* pExtComplexSelector = &seq;    // The selector up to where the @extend is (ie, the thing to merge)
01539       Compound_Selector* pExtCompoundSelector = pSels; // All the simple selectors to be replaced from the current compound selector from all extensions
01540 
01541 
01542 
01543       // TODO: This can return a Compound_Selector with no elements. Should that just be returning NULL?
01544       Compound_Selector* pSelectorWithoutExtendSelectors = pSelector->minus(pExtCompoundSelector, ctx);
01545 
01546 
01547 //      DEBUG_EXEC(EXTEND_COMPOUND, printCompoundSelector(pSelector, "MEMBERS: "))
01548 //      DEBUG_EXEC(EXTEND_COMPOUND, printCompoundSelector(pSelectorWithoutExtendSelectors, "SELF_WO_SEL: "))
01549 
01550 
01551       Compound_Selector* pInnermostCompoundSelector = pExtComplexSelector->base();
01552       Compound_Selector* pUnifiedSelector = NULL;
01553 
01554       if (!pInnermostCompoundSelector) {
01555         pInnermostCompoundSelector = new (ctx.mem) Compound_Selector(pSelector->pstate());
01556       }
01557 
01558       pUnifiedSelector = pInnermostCompoundSelector->unify_with(pSelectorWithoutExtendSelectors, ctx);
01559 
01560 //      DEBUG_EXEC(EXTEND_COMPOUND, printCompoundSelector(pInnermostCompoundSelector, "LHS: "))
01561 //      DEBUG_EXEC(EXTEND_COMPOUND, printCompoundSelector(pSelectorWithoutExtendSelectors, "RHS: "))
01562 //      DEBUG_EXEC(EXTEND_COMPOUND, printCompoundSelector(pUnifiedSelector, "UNIFIED: "))
01563 
01564       if (!pUnifiedSelector || pUnifiedSelector->length() == 0) {
01565         continue;
01566       }
01567 
01568 
01569 
01570       // TODO: implement the parent directive match (if necessary based on test failures)
01571       // next if group.map {|e, _| check_directives_match!(e, parent_directives)}.none?
01572 
01573 
01574 
01575 
01576       // TODO: This seems a little fishy to me. See if it causes any problems. From the ruby, we should be able to just
01577       // get rid of the last Compound_Selector and replace it with this one. I think the reason this code is more
01578       // complex is that Complex_Selector contains a combinator, but in ruby combinators have already been filtered
01579       // out and aren't operated on.
01580       Complex_Selector* pNewSelector = pExtComplexSelector->cloneFully(ctx);
01581       Complex_Selector* pNewInnerMost = new (ctx.mem) Complex_Selector(pSelector->pstate(), Complex_Selector::ANCESTOR_OF, pUnifiedSelector, NULL);
01582       Complex_Selector::Combinator combinator = pNewSelector->clear_innermost();
01583       pNewSelector->set_innermost(pNewInnerMost, combinator);
01584 
01585 #ifdef DEBUG
01586       SourcesSet debugSet;
01587       debugSet = pNewSelector->sources();
01588       if (debugSet.size() > 0) {
01589         throw "The new selector should start with no sources. Something needs to be cloned to fix this.";
01590       }
01591       debugSet = pExtComplexSelector->sources();
01592       if (debugSet.size() > 0) {
01593         throw "The extension selector from our subset map should not have sources. These will bleed to the new selector. Something needs to be cloned to fix this.";
01594       }
01595 #endif
01596 
01597 
01598       if (pSelector && pSelector->has_line_feed()) pNewSelector->has_line_feed(true);
01599 
01600       // Set the sources on our new Complex_Selector to the sources of this simple sequence plus the thing we're extending.
01601       DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPOUND, "SOURCES SETTING ON NEW SEQ: " << complexSelectorToNode(pNewSelector, ctx))
01602 
01603       DEBUG_EXEC(EXTEND_COMPOUND, SourcesSet oldSet = pNewSelector->sources(); printSourcesSet(oldSet, ctx, "SOURCES NEW SEQ BEGIN: "))
01604 
01605       SourcesSet newSourcesSet = pSelector->sources();
01606       DEBUG_EXEC(EXTEND_COMPOUND, printSourcesSet(newSourcesSet, ctx, "SOURCES THIS EXTEND: "))
01607 
01608       newSourcesSet.insert(pExtComplexSelector);
01609       DEBUG_EXEC(EXTEND_COMPOUND, printSourcesSet(newSourcesSet, ctx, "SOURCES WITH NEW SOURCE: "))
01610 
01611       pNewSelector->addSources(newSourcesSet, ctx);
01612 
01613       DEBUG_EXEC(EXTEND_COMPOUND, SourcesSet newSet = pNewSelector->sources(); printSourcesSet(newSet, ctx, "SOURCES ON NEW SELECTOR AFTER ADD: "))
01614       DEBUG_EXEC(EXTEND_COMPOUND, printSourcesSet(pSelector->sources(), ctx, "SOURCES THIS EXTEND WHICH SHOULD BE SAME STILL: "))
01615 
01616 
01617 
01618       holder.push_back(make_pair(pSels, pNewSelector));
01619     }
01620 
01621 
01622     for (SelsNewSeqPairCollection::iterator holderIter = holder.begin(), holderIterEnd = holder.end(); holderIter != holderIterEnd; holderIter++) {
01623       SelsNewSeqPair& pair = *holderIter;
01624 
01625       Compound_Selector* pSels = pair.first;
01626       Complex_Selector* pNewSelector = pair.second;
01627 
01628 
01629       if (seen.find(*pSels) != seen.end()) {
01630         continue;
01631       }
01632 
01633 
01634       set<Compound_Selector> recurseSeen(seen);
01635       recurseSeen.insert(*pSels);
01636 
01637 
01638       DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPOUND, "RECURSING DO EXTEND: " << complexSelectorToNode(pNewSelector, ctx))
01639 
01640       Node recurseExtendedSelectors = extendComplexSelector(pNewSelector, ctx, subsetMap, recurseSeen);
01641 
01642       DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPOUND, "RECURSING DO EXTEND RETURN: " << recurseExtendedSelectors)
01643 
01644       for (NodeDeque::iterator iterator = recurseExtendedSelectors.collection()->begin(), endIterator = recurseExtendedSelectors.collection()->end();
01645            iterator != endIterator; ++iterator) {
01646         Node& newSelector = *iterator;
01647 
01648 //        DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPOUND, "EXTENDED AT THIS POINT: " << extendedSelectors)
01649 //        DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPOUND, "SELECTOR EXISTS ALREADY: " << newSelector << " " << extendedSelectors.contains(newSelector, false /*simpleSelectorOrderDependent*/));
01650 
01651         if (!extendedSelectors.contains(newSelector, false /*simpleSelectorOrderDependent*/)) {
01652 //          DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPOUND, "ADDING NEW SELECTOR")
01653           extendedSelectors.collection()->push_back(newSelector);
01654         }
01655       }
01656     }
01657 
01658     DEBUG_EXEC(EXTEND_COMPOUND, printCompoundSelector(pSelector, "EXTEND COMPOUND END: "))
01659 
01660     return extendedSelectors;
01661   }
01662 
01663 
01664   static bool complexSelectorHasExtension(
01665     Complex_Selector* pComplexSelector,
01666     Context& ctx,
01667     ExtensionSubsetMap& subsetMap) {
01668 
01669     bool hasExtension = false;
01670 
01671     Complex_Selector* pIter = pComplexSelector;
01672 
01673     while (!hasExtension && pIter) {
01674       Compound_Selector* pHead = pIter->head();
01675 
01676       if (pHead) {
01677         SubsetMapEntries entries = subsetMap.get_v(pHead->to_str_vec());
01678         for (ExtensionPair ext : entries) {
01679           // check if both selectors have the same media block parent
01680           if (ext.first->media_block() == pComplexSelector->media_block()) continue;
01681           To_String to_string(&ctx);
01682           if (ext.second->media_block() == 0) continue;
01683           if (pComplexSelector->media_block() &&
01684               ext.second->media_block()->media_queries() &&
01685               pComplexSelector->media_block()->media_queries()
01686           ) {
01687             string query_left(ext.second->media_block()->media_queries()->perform(&to_string));
01688             string query_right(pComplexSelector->media_block()->media_queries()->perform(&to_string));
01689             if (query_left == query_right) continue;
01690           }
01691 
01692           // fail if one goes across media block boundaries
01693           stringstream err;
01694           string cwd(Sass::File::get_cwd());
01695           ParserState pstate(ext.second->pstate());
01696           string rel_path(Sass::File::resolve_relative_path(pstate.path, cwd, cwd));
01697           err << "You may not @extend an outer selector from within @media.\n";
01698           err << "You may only @extend selectors within the same directive.\n";
01699           err << "From \"@extend " << ext.second->perform(&to_string) << "\"";
01700           err << " on line " << pstate.line+1 << " of " << rel_path << "\n";
01701           error(err.str(), pComplexSelector->pstate());
01702         }
01703         if (entries.size() > 0) hasExtension = true;
01704       }
01705 
01706       pIter = pIter->tail();
01707     }
01708 
01709     if (!hasExtension) {
01710       /* ToDo: don't break stuff
01711       stringstream err;
01712       To_String to_string(&ctx);
01713       string cwd(Sass::File::get_cwd());
01714       string sel1(pComplexSelector->perform(&to_string));
01715       Compound_Selector* pExtendSelector = 0;
01716       for (auto i : subsetMap.values()) {
01717         if (i.first == pComplexSelector) {
01718           pExtendSelector = i.second;
01719           break;
01720         }
01721       }
01722       if (!pExtendSelector || !pExtendSelector->is_optional()) {
01723         string sel2(pExtendSelector ? pExtendSelector->perform(&to_string) : "[unknown]");
01724         err << "\"" << sel1 << "\" failed to @extend \"" << sel2 << "\"\n";
01725         err << "The selector \"" << sel2 << "\" was not found.\n";
01726         err << "Use \"@extend " << sel2 << " !optional\" if the extend should be able to fail.";
01727         error(err.str(), pExtendSelector ? pExtendSelector->pstate() : pComplexSelector->pstate());
01728       }
01729       */
01730     }
01731 
01732     return hasExtension;
01733   }
01734 
01735 
01736   /*
01737    This is the equivalent of ruby's Sequence.do_extend.
01738 
01739    // TODO: I think I have some modified ruby code to put here. Check.
01740    */
01741   /*
01742    ISSUES:
01743    - check to automatically include combinators doesn't transfer over to libsass' data model where
01744      the combinator and compound selector are one unit
01745      next [[sseq_or_op]] unless sseq_or_op.is_a?(SimpleSequence)
01746    */
01747   static Node extendComplexSelector(
01748     Complex_Selector* pComplexSelector,
01749     Context& ctx,
01750     ExtensionSubsetMap& subsetMap,
01751     set<Compound_Selector> seen) {
01752 
01753     pComplexSelector->tail()->has_line_feed(pComplexSelector->has_line_feed());
01754 
01755     Node complexSelector = complexSelectorToNode(pComplexSelector, ctx);
01756     DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPLEX, "EXTEND COMPLEX: " << complexSelector)
01757 
01758     Node extendedNotExpanded = Node::createCollection();
01759 
01760     for (NodeDeque::iterator complexSelIter = complexSelector.collection()->begin(), complexSelIterEnd = complexSelector.collection()->end(); complexSelIter != complexSelIterEnd; ++complexSelIter) {
01761       Node& sseqOrOp = *complexSelIter;
01762 
01763       DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPLEX, "LOOP: " << sseqOrOp)
01764 
01765       // If it's not a selector (meaning it's a combinator), just include it automatically
01766       if (!sseqOrOp.isSelector()) {
01767         // Wrap our Combinator in two collections to match ruby. This is essentially making a collection Node
01768         // with one collection child. The collection child represents a Complex_Selector that is only a combinator.
01769         Node outer = Node::createCollection();
01770         Node inner = Node::createCollection();
01771         outer.collection()->push_back(inner);
01772         inner.collection()->push_back(sseqOrOp);
01773         extendedNotExpanded.collection()->push_back(outer);
01774         continue;
01775       }
01776 
01777       Compound_Selector* pCompoundSelector = sseqOrOp.selector()->head();
01778 
01779       Node extended = extendCompoundSelector(pCompoundSelector, ctx, subsetMap, seen);
01780 
01781       DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPLEX, "EXTENDED: " << extended)
01782 
01783 
01784       // Prepend the Compound_Selector based on the choices logic; choices seems to be extend but with an ruby Array instead of a Sequence
01785       // due to the member mapping: choices = extended.map {|seq| seq.members}
01786       Complex_Selector* pJustCurrentCompoundSelector = sseqOrOp.selector();
01787 
01788       bool isSuperselector = false;
01789       for (NodeDeque::iterator iterator = extended.collection()->begin(), endIterator = extended.collection()->end();
01790            iterator != endIterator; ++iterator) {
01791         Node& childNode = *iterator;
01792         Complex_Selector* pExtensionSelector = nodeToComplexSelector(childNode, ctx);
01793         if (pExtensionSelector->is_superselector_of(pJustCurrentCompoundSelector)) {
01794           isSuperselector = true;
01795           break;
01796         }
01797       }
01798 
01799       if (!isSuperselector) {
01800         extended.collection()->push_front(complexSelectorToNode(pJustCurrentCompoundSelector, ctx));
01801       }
01802 
01803       DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPLEX, "CHOICES UNSHIFTED: " << extended)
01804 
01805       // Aggregate our current extensions
01806       extendedNotExpanded.collection()->push_back(extended);
01807     }
01808 
01809 
01810     DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPLEX, "EXTENDED NOT EXPANDED: " << extendedNotExpanded)
01811 
01812 
01813 
01814     // Ruby Equivalent: paths
01815     Node paths = Sass::paths(extendedNotExpanded, ctx);
01816 
01817     DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPLEX, "PATHS: " << paths)
01818 
01819 
01820 
01821     // Ruby Equivalent: weave
01822     Node weaves = Node::createCollection();
01823 
01824     for (NodeDeque::iterator pathsIter = paths.collection()->begin(), pathsEndIter = paths.collection()->end(); pathsIter != pathsEndIter; ++pathsIter) {
01825       Node& path = *pathsIter;
01826       Node weaved = weave(path, ctx);
01827       weaves.collection()->push_back(weaved);
01828     }
01829 
01830     DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPLEX, "WEAVES: " << weaves)
01831 
01832 
01833 
01834     // Ruby Equivalent: trim
01835     Node trimmed = trim(weaves, ctx);
01836 
01837     DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPLEX, "TRIMMED: " << trimmed)
01838 
01839 
01840     // Ruby Equivalent: flatten
01841     Node extendedSelectors = flatten(trimmed, ctx, 1);
01842 
01843     DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPLEX, ">>>>> EXTENDED: " << extendedSelectors)
01844 
01845 
01846     DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_COMPLEX, "EXTEND COMPLEX END: " << complexSelector)
01847 
01848 
01849     return extendedSelectors;
01850   }
01851 
01852 
01853 
01854   /*
01855    This is the equivalent of ruby's CommaSequence.do_extend.
01856   */
01857   static Selector_List* extendSelectorList(Selector_List* pSelectorList, Context& ctx, ExtensionSubsetMap& subsetMap, bool& extendedSomething) {
01858 
01859     To_String to_string(&ctx);
01860 
01861     Selector_List* pNewSelectors = new (ctx.mem) Selector_List(pSelectorList->pstate(), pSelectorList->length());
01862 
01863     extendedSomething = false;
01864 
01865     for (size_t index = 0, length = pSelectorList->length(); index < length; index++) {
01866       Complex_Selector* pSelector = (*pSelectorList)[index];
01867 
01868       // ruby sass seems to keep a list of things that have extensions and then only extend those. We don't currently do that.
01869       // Since it's not that expensive to check if an extension exists in the subset map and since it can be relatively expensive to
01870       // run through the extend code (which does a data model transformation), check if there is anything to extend before doing
01871       // the extend. We might be able to optimize extendComplexSelector, but this approach keeps us closer to ruby sass (which helps
01872       // when debugging).
01873       if (!complexSelectorHasExtension(pSelector, ctx, subsetMap)) {
01874         *pNewSelectors << pSelector;
01875         continue;
01876       }
01877 
01878       extendedSomething = true;
01879 
01880       set<Compound_Selector> seen;
01881       Node extendedSelectors = extendComplexSelector(pSelector, ctx, subsetMap, seen);
01882 
01883       if (!pSelector->has_placeholder()) {
01884         if (!extendedSelectors.contains(complexSelectorToNode(pSelector, ctx), true /*simpleSelectorOrderDependent*/)) {
01885           *pNewSelectors << pSelector;
01886         }
01887       }
01888 
01889       for (NodeDeque::iterator iterator = extendedSelectors.collection()->begin(), iteratorEnd = extendedSelectors.collection()->end(); iterator != iteratorEnd; ++iterator) {
01890         Node& childNode = *iterator;
01891         *pNewSelectors << nodeToComplexSelector(childNode, ctx);
01892       }
01893     }
01894 
01895     return pNewSelectors;
01896 
01897   }
01898 
01899 
01900   bool shouldExtendBlock(Block* b) {
01901 
01902     // If a block is empty, there's no reason to extend it since any rules placed on this block
01903     // won't have any output. The main benefit of this is for structures like:
01904     //
01905     //    .a {
01906     //      .b {
01907     //        x: y;
01908     //      }
01909     //    }
01910     //
01911     // We end up visiting two rulesets (one with the selector .a and the other with the selector .a .b).
01912     // In this case, we don't want to try to pull rules onto .a since they won't get output anyway since
01913     // there are no child statements. However .a .b should have extensions applied.
01914 
01915     for (size_t i = 0, L = b->length(); i < L; ++i) {
01916       Statement* stm = (*b)[i];
01917 
01918       if (typeid(*stm) == typeid(Ruleset)) {
01919         // Do nothing. This doesn't count as a statement that causes extension since we'll iterate over this rule set in a future visit and try to extend it.
01920       }
01921       else {
01922         return true;
01923       }
01924     }
01925 
01926     return false;
01927 
01928   }
01929 
01930 
01931   // Extend a ruleset by extending the selectors and updating them on the ruleset. The block's rules don't need to change.
01932   template <typename ObjectType>
01933   static void extendObjectWithSelectorAndBlock(ObjectType* pObject, Context& ctx, ExtensionSubsetMap& subsetMap) {
01934     To_String to_string(&ctx);
01935 
01936     DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_OBJECT, "FOUND SELECTOR: " << static_cast<Selector_List*>(pObject->selector())->perform(&to_string))
01937 
01938     // Ruby sass seems to filter nodes that don't have any content well before we get here. I'm not sure the repercussions
01939     // of doing so, so for now, let's just not extend things that won't be output later.
01940     if (!shouldExtendBlock(pObject->block())) {
01941       DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_OBJECT, "RETURNING WITHOUT EXTEND ATTEMPT")
01942       return;
01943     }
01944 
01945     bool extendedSomething = false;
01946     Selector_List* pNewSelectorList = extendSelectorList(static_cast<Selector_List*>(pObject->selector()), ctx, subsetMap, extendedSomething);
01947 
01948     if (extendedSomething && pNewSelectorList) {
01949       DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_OBJECT, "EXTEND ORIGINAL SELECTORS: " << static_cast<Selector_List*>(pObject->selector())->perform(&to_string))
01950       DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_OBJECT, "EXTEND SETTING NEW SELECTORS: " << pNewSelectorList->perform(&to_string))
01951 
01952       // re-parse in order to restructure expanded placeholder nodes correctly.
01953       //
01954       // TODO: I don't know if this is needed, but it was in the original C++ implementation, so I kept it. Try running the tests without re-parsing.
01955       // this probably messes up source-maps
01956       pObject->selector(
01957         Parser::from_c_str(
01958           (pNewSelectorList->perform(&to_string) + ";").c_str(),
01959           ctx,
01960           pNewSelectorList->pstate()
01961         ).parse_selector_group()
01962       );
01963     } else {
01964       DEBUG_PRINTLN(EXTEND_OBJECT, "EXTEND DID NOT TRY TO EXTEND ANYTHING")
01965     }
01966   }
01967 
01968 
01969 
01970   Extend::Extend(Context& ctx, ExtensionSubsetMap& ssm)
01971   : ctx(ctx), subset_map(ssm)
01972   { }
01973 
01974   void Extend::operator()(Block* b)
01975   {
01976     for (size_t i = 0, L = b->length(); i < L; ++i) {
01977       (*b)[i]->perform(this);
01978     }
01979   }
01980 
01981   void Extend::operator()(Ruleset* pRuleset)
01982   {
01983     extendObjectWithSelectorAndBlock(pRuleset, ctx, subset_map);
01984 
01985     pRuleset->block()->perform(this);
01986   }
01987 
01988   void Extend::operator()(Feature_Block* pFeatureBlock)
01989   {
01990     if (pFeatureBlock->selector()) {
01991       extendObjectWithSelectorAndBlock(pFeatureBlock, ctx, subset_map);
01992     }
01993 
01994     pFeatureBlock->block()->perform(this);
01995   }
01996 
01997   void Extend::operator()(Media_Block* pMediaBlock)
01998   {
01999     if (pMediaBlock->selector()) {
02000       extendObjectWithSelectorAndBlock(pMediaBlock, ctx, subset_map);
02001     }
02002 
02003     pMediaBlock->block()->perform(this);
02004   }
02005 
02006   void Extend::operator()(At_Rule* a)
02007   {
02008     if (a->block()) a->block()->perform(this);
02009   }
